newsitem.title: USA: Giddings & Lewis CFO to retire.
newsitem.headline: Giddings & Lewis CFO to retire.

text.p: Giddings & Lewis Inc. said Wednesday that Richard Kleinfeldt, chief financial officer, said he will retire effective April 1, 1997.
Kleinfeldt began his career with Giddings & Lewis on June 15, 1964 as an accountant. He became chief financial officer and secretary in July 1989.

In order to accommodate the company in its search for his successor, Kleinfeldt resigned as vice president, finance and chief financial officer and as a member of the board effective December 3, the company said.
Giddings & Lewis is supplies and integrates automated machining and assembly systems.
